newsitem.title: USA: Conoco in talks to acquire Lobo Trend assets.
newsitem.headline: Conoco in talks to acquire Lobo Trend assets.

text.p: Conoco Inc is in talks to acquire TransTexas Gas Corp's Lobo Trend natural gas assets, a company spokesman said on Wednesday.
"We confirm we are negotiating to acquire assets in the Lobo Field that are currently owned by TransTexas Gas Corporation," Conoco spokesman Carlton Adams said.
TransTexas on Wednesday said it was in talks to sell its Lobo Trend natural gas properties and an 1,100 mile pipeline for more than $1.1 billion in cash.

The Conoco spokesman declined comment on terms of the deal it was striking with TransTexas, but said the acquisition was approved by parent DuPont's board subject to negotiation of a definitive agreement.

Conoco is the second largest producer of natural gas in the Lobo field, and the acquisition of the TransTexas exploration and production and gas transmission assets was seen as a "strong strategic fit" for the Houston company, Adams said.
